segments.text: NARRATOR: It is teatime and Mummy Pig has a surprise for everyone.
(OINKS) Today is a day for pancakes.
(OINKS) I'm the expert at flipping the pancakes over.
Last time you got a bit grumpy
when you dropped the pancake on the floor.
There was a problem with the frying pan.
Mummy, can we help make the pancakes, please?
Yes, you can help me make the batter. (OINKS)
First I put some flour in the bowl.
MUMMY PIG: Now I add an egg.
And I give it all a stir.
You two sit at the table while I cook the pancakes.
NARRATOR: Mummy Pig is going to flip the pancake over.
You could flip it higher, Mummy Pig.
when you flip your own pancake, Daddy Pig.
NARRATOR: This first pancake is for George.
Mummy Pig pours a little syrup on George's pancake.
-PEPPA PIG: Hooray! -(KIDS AND MUMMY PIG LAUGH)
Hmm, you could flip it higher, Mummy Pig.
MUMMY PIG: You will get a chance to show me
when you flip your own pancake, Daddy Pig.
NARRATOR: This pancake is for Mummy Pig.
-PEPPA PIG: Hooray! -(KIDS AND MUMMY PIG LAUGH)
You still aren't flipping them high enough, Mummy Pig.
(OINKS) The next pancake is yours, Daddy Pig.
So now you can show us how it should be done.
The secret of making a good pancake
is to flip it high into the air.
Maybe that was just a bit too high.
It should be a simple matter to get it down. (GRUNTS)
NARRATOR: Oh, dear, Daddy Pig cannot reach his pancake.
Don't worry, Daddy Pig. I think I know a way to get it down.
NARRATOR: What is Mummy Pig planning to do?
we all have to start jumping up and down.
NARRATOR: It worked. Now Daddy Pig has his pancake.
Daddy has a pancake on his head.
-(KIDS AND MUMMY PIG LAUGH) -DADDY PIG: Hmm.
Syrup on your pancake, Daddy Pig?
(narrator): Peppa and her friends are playing at the clubhouse.
- What did you have for dinner last night?
- I had spaghetti. - I had baked beans.
- For my dinner, I had a pizza takeaway.
- A takeaway is when you ring up the food place and tell them what you want.
They do all the cooking... and bring it to your house.
Then you pay for it by beeping your card.
(snorting) - They bring food to your house?!
- And they cook it for you? - Yes.
And it was so yummy, we gave it five stars!
(all): Ooh! - Let's do a pretend takeaway!
- We are pretending the clubhouse is a takeaway! (Daddy Pig chuckling)
- That sounds like fun. - I love takeaways.
- You have to ring up and tell us what you want. (laughter)
- Hello. Can I order some food, please?
- I can't hear you very well!
- I don't know what that is!
- Please, may I have a pizza?!
- And I would like a pie.
- A salad, a pizza and a pie coming right up.
- Now we need to find some things to cook.
- Green and crunchy things for a salad...
- And tasty things for a pie. (giggling)
(narrator): Danny, Freddy and Candy are finding things to cook.
- Green and crunchy things for a salad.
- Now we cook the food in our toy oven.
You can't do takeaway food without boxes.
- Daddy, have you got boxes? - Here.
- Who's gonna take them to the mummies and daddies?
- Me! (squeaking) Send them down the slide!
(narrator): Mandy Mouse is taking food to the parents. (giggling)
- Um, but I ordered a salad. - That is salad.
- Now beep your card to pay.
- And what do we have here? - It's your pie, Daddy.
(sniffing) - Wow! That is a tasty pie!
- Oh. Would you like some of my pizza?
- So how many stars would you give our sandwiches?
- But not as good as a clubhouse takeaway.
- The clubhouse takeaway is the best takeaway
(narrator): Peppa and her family are in America, on their way to Hollywood.
- A motor home is a house that you can drive.
- Are we in Hollywood yet, Daddy Pig? - Let's ask someone.
- Well howdy folks, I'm Miss Rabbit.
- Yup! There are a lot of us about.
What can I do ya for? Stoppin' for some gas?
- No. - A bite to eat? - Well, we...
- Country dancing? - We would just like to know if we're in Hollywood, please.
- No ma'am, you're a long way from Hollywood. - Oh.
- But as you're here, why don't you just settle down
and get some of that good ol' home-cookin in your belly?
- Well, I suppose we could stop for breakfast.
Eggs over-easy? No need to frown! ♪
(laughing) - Eggs over easy, please. - Coming right up!
♪ Cookin' an egg and shakin' a leg!
Cookin' and shakin' an cookin' an egg! ♪
- I don't flip the egg over, it stays like this!
- Sunny side up please! - And me! - Snort!
- Miss Rabbit is good at cooking eggs!
♪ Cookin' an egg and shakin' a leg!
Cookin' and shakin' an cookin' an egg! ♪
- I love my sunny side up egg!
(laughing, crunching) - Thank you! That was delicious.
Now I'll just sit back, relax and...
Then y'all come and meet Mr. Bob Bobcat and his band.
- All join hands and step to the right.
Keep on stepping and make it tight.
Oh my gosh! Oh my Joe! Keep on stepping and here we go!
- Let's all join in! - Y'all be needing these!
- Take your partner by the hand!
- Peppa? Would you like to do the singing?
Jump up and down like you're in a puddle!
- Ho ho! Well, I've never done a square dance like that before!
- Could you keep the noise down, please? We can't hear our monster trucks.
- This is a monster truck. - Wow!
Those big wheels have got a car on top of them!
- Mr. Coyote is going to jump over a big muddy puddle.
- You can have a go, Daddy Pig.
- Oh... It is a bit high.
- Daddy Pig does not like heights.
- You need to go faster to jump over the puddle!
- Daddy's truck is jumping up and down in muddy puddles!
Mummy, why don't you have a go?
- Oh... I think we need to get back on the road to Hollywood.
- Hollywood? - Yes, we're going to be in a movie
with Super Potato and Hash Brown.
- Hash Brown? Why, he's my favourite!
- You can come too if you like!
- I would love to, darling but I'm kinda busy.
Goodbye now, thanks for stopping by!
- Peppa and her family are back on the road to Hollywood.
- Peppa and George are at Granny and Grandpa Pig's house today.
- Mr. Labrador is here in his new ice cream van.
- Everyone is queueing for ice cream.
- Is the vanilla ice cream nice?
- Oh, I don't know. I haven't tried it yet.
- It is Mr. Labrador's first day selling ice creams.
Would you like one? - Yes, please!
- I want a strawberry ice cream!
- Is the mint ice cream good?
- It is Peppa and George's turn.
- Can I have a strawberry ice cream, please?
- Ah, I seem to have run out of strawberry ice cream.
- Then can I have a vanilla ice cream, please?
Actually, I've got no ice cream left at all. (chuckles)
Maybe I tried too many myself?
Let's make our own ice cream instead.
- Yes! We used to make ice cream for your mummy
when she was a little piggy.
Hop aboard and I'll take you back home.
- Can we have the ice cream music, please?
- First, we pour some milk into a jug.
- Now, what flavour would you like your ice cream to be?
Let's make raspberry and strawberry ice cream!
- Hee, hee, hee! - In, they go.
Then we pour all our ingredients into a freezer bag.
- Now we need to make it very cold.
- We'll put the ice cream bag
into this bag full of ice and salt.
- And wrap it all in a towel.
We shake it up and down for five minutes.
- You can start the shaking, Peppa.
- One last shake from me and I think it might be ready!
It's the best ice cream in the world!
- Granny? Can all my friends come for ice cream?
we'll need to make a lot more ice cream.
The best ice cream in the world!
- All of Peppa's friends are here for ice cream.
Made with carrots from my very own garden.
- We all love ice cream, Mr. Labrador!
- Yes, but I really love ice cream.
- (laughing) - It is almost lunchtime at Peppa's house.
- Snort! What does everyone fancy for lunch today?
- Ho, ho! I'm a bit of an expert at making pizza!
...and for toppings, we've got all sorts of nice things.
- George likes pineapple on his pizza!
In fact, I think pineapple on pizza is against the law!
- It is actually not against the law to put pineapple on pizza.
- Um, Daddy, can we make funny faces on top of the pizzas?
- But before we start cooking, we have to wash our hands.
- (altogether, to the tune of Row, Row, Row Your Boat)
could you please mix this flour and water
- Perfect! I'm just going to knead it.
- We sprinkle a little flour on the table
- You need to be big and strong to knead dough!
- And George is big and strong too!
Let's make the dough into four balls...
- And we roll them flat with a rolling pin.
- Ah! It looks like a pizza now!
- (splat) - Daddy has a pizza on his head.
- Ho, ho! This one can be mine.
- Peppa, George, please smooth the tomato over the pizzas.
- Good. That's enough smoothing and splashing.
- Remember Daddy, we're making funny faces!
I'll use mushrooms to make eyes...
- And I'll use onion for eyes
and basil leaves for the mouth.
- I'm doing little tomatoes for the eyes
and sweet corn for the mouth!
- Grunt! Grunt! - George is using pineapple for the eyes
- Hee, hee! I like funny faces! Snort!
- While they cook, we can tidy up all this mess.
- Um. You and Mummy can tidy up,
and George and I can do some playing.
Mummy and Daddy Pig like tidying up.
- Mummy, your pizza looks like you!
- (Peppa) And your pizza looks like you, Daddy!
- It looks nothing like me! Ho, ho, ho, ho!
- I must say, your pizza does look like you, Peppa.
These are the best pizzas in the world ever!
(narrator): Mummy Pig is working on her computer.
Can me and George play on the computer?
I've got a lot of important work to do today.
- You two can help me in the kitchen.
that needs a jolly good tidy!
- Could you pass me a pan, please?
- That is a special bowl for making jelly.
Maybe it can be a surprise for Mummy Pig!
- First, we need to go to the shops
and get everything we need to make jelly.
- Daddy, what things do we need to make jelly?
To make jelly, we just need, uh...
- It doesn't look very wibbly or wobbly.
- We add water to make it wibbly-wobbly.
- Oh. - What flavour do you want?
- I don't think they have cheese jelly, George.
- Remember, the jelly is for Mummy Pig.
What do you think she would like?
Can you guess what we're making?
- I love jelly! All wibbly-wobbly and delicious!
and take out the jelly cubes.
- Ooh, they are a bit wibbly and wobbly.
- We break the jelly cubes into a bowl,
A grown-up must do this bit.
- The water has gone strawberry colour!
- Yes! The jelly cubes have melted.
Now we can pour it into the jelly mould!
- The fridge will make it go cold and wobbly.
- Not long, let's set the timer.
let's make Mummy a card to go with the jelly!
a jelly card for Mummy Pig.
- Very good! What shall we write inside?
all this jelly is for you.
- We just turn the mould over on the plate,
It is wibbly and it's wobbly!
(narrator): Mummy Pig has finished her important work!
And some for me, and George, and Daddy!
NARRATOR: Peppa and George have come to
Granny Pig and Grandpa Pig's house for lunch.
(OINKS) Would you like to pick some vegetables
NARRATOR: This is Grandpa Pig's vegetable garden.
He has grown all these vegetables himself.
(OINKS) Let's choose some vegetables for lunch.
Oh, dear. I must have something that George likes.
NARRATOR: George does not like cucumbers
and he does not like lettuce and he does not like tomatoes.
(LAUGHS) Maybe George will like the vegetables
when they're made into a lovely salad.
Ooh, lovely fresh tomatoes, lettuce and cucumber.
(OINKS) First we have to wash them.
NARRATOR: Peppa and George helped Granny Pig wash the vegetables.
NARRATOR: Granny Pig has made the tomatoes, lettuce and cucumber into a salad.
Grandpa Pig, can you call everyone to lunch?
NARRATOR: Granny Pig has made pizza for lunch.
made with Grandpa's tomatoes, lettuce, and cucumber.
NARRATOR: George has eaten his pizza,
but George does not like the tomatoes or the lettuce or the cucumber.
Oh, dear, George. Don't you like the salad?
George, just try a little bit of this lovely tomato.
Grandpa Pig grew it in his garden.
Try a piece of lettuce, George.
George is eating the tomatoes, lettuce and cucumber.
Would you like some more, George?
George, are you too full to eat any more tomatoes,
NARRATOR: George is too full to eat anymore.
George, are you too full to eat anything more?
NARRATOR: George is too full to eat anything more.
Oh, well, then you won't want
My word! George seems to have got his appetite back.
NARRATOR: It is a lovely bright, sunny day.
Peppa and her family are going for a picnic.
Daddy Pig is bringing the picnic basket.
tomatoes and lemonade. Is there anything we've forgotten?
Mummy's home-made strawberry cake is there, too.
This looks like just the spot for our picnic.
Ahhh! It's great to be outdoors!
We should run around a bit and get some exercise!
(SNORTS) I want to eat, then have a nap.
I certainly don't want to run around.
Maybe Daddy should run around a bit, his tummy is quite big.
but later, I will get some exercise, even if no-one else does.
I thought you wanted to run around a bit, Daddy Pig.
(SNORTS) Look, there's a little duck pond!
(SNORTS) Mummy, can we feed the ducks?
Yes, you can feed them the rest of the bread.
NARRATOR: Peppa and George love feeding bread to ducks.
Mummy, I think they want some more.
That was the last of the bread. I'm sure they've had enough.
(SNORTS) Sorry, Mrs. Duck, we have no more bread.
-(DUCKS QUACK) -NARRATOR: The ducks want more food.
So much for Daddy Pig and his exercise!
(SNORTS) Peppa told you, there's no more bread!
Well, if there's any cake left over,
-you can give it to the ducks. -(ALL LAUGH)
NARRATOR: Everyone likes Mummy Pig's home-made strawberry cake.
What a fuss, Mummy Pig! It's only a little wasp!
-Go away, wasp! -Just stay still, Mummy Pig,
There. You see? All you had to do was stay still.
Whoa! Shoo! (SNORTS) Get it off me!
(SNORTS) I hope the wasp doesn't sting Daddy.
No! Get away, you little pest! (SNORTS)
No, Daddy Pig is running too fast for the wasp to catch him.
Let's eat our cake before the wasp comes back.
Oh, no, we forgot to leave any for the ducks!
(SNORTS) You said you would run around and get some exercise, Daddy Pig,
but I didn't believe you'd do it.
(LAUGHS, SNORTS) Luckily, I managed to hang
onto my slice of strawberry cake.
We promised the rest of the cake for the ducks.
-Say thank you to Daddy Pig. -(DUCKS QUACK)
It's time to go home. Say goodbye to the ducks.
- Peppa and her family are dressed in their very best clothes.
- (sing song voice) A party! A party! We're going to a party!
- You know, it's not really a party, Peppa.
- It's just a nice quiet meal in a restaurant,
- And you haven't been to a restaurant before, have you?
- No. - So that will be fun, won't it?
- Peppa and her family have arrived at the restaurant.
- Why? - We have to be shown to our table by the waiter.
- (clears throat) Have you booked a table?
- Are you here for the party?
- Shush, Peppa! These people are having their own meals.
- And remember, it's not really a party. - Oh.
- But it's sad it's not a real birthday party.
- I think I'm a bit too old for a real party, Peppa. Snort.
- I think Grandpa would rather have a nice quiet meal.
That's not a hat! It's a napkin!
- The napkins are to stop food and drink
- (clears throat) Would you like to order drinks, Madam?
- Could we have a bottle of water, please?
- Of course! Can I get you anything else?
Because it is my Grandpa's birthday.
I'll see what I can do.
- Peppa! They don't have party hats in posh restaurants like this!
- Are you ready to order food?
- On the menu today we have...
Strained carrot on a muscle cough...
Or Cream of swede in a vegetable sog.
- Umm... I think I might try the... ugh...
strained carrot on a muscle cough.
- Err... Cream of swede for me, please.
- Spaghetti is not on the menu...
But I will ask the chef.
- Peppa! You can't ask for things that aren't on the menu!
And for the children, the chef has made spaghetti.
Could I have the spaghetti too, please?
- (calling out in turn) And me! And me! And me...!
- Would you like some cheese on your spaghetti?
- This is starting to feel like a birthday party! Snort!
- The only thing missing is the cake!
- Peppa and George are visiting Granny and Grandpa Pig.
- Come and see the strawberries I've grown!
- Grandpa Pig has spent days and days growing strawberries!
- I think you will be impressed.
- Perhaps we can some strawberry jam? - Snort!
- Peppa and George love strawberry jam!
- One strawberry?! You've grown one strawberry!
- It will be the best tasting strawberry ever!
- Why is it hiding in a little house, Grandpa?
- It is hiding because the cheeky little birds
- So now, there are no strawberries.
I know a place that has lots of strawberries!
- So, that's where we will go!
- Hello there! Have you come to pick strawberries?
- Then you've come to the right place!
We've got nothing here but strawberries!
- Pick as many as you like! - (giggling)
- Here is Pedro Pony, with his mummy and daddy.
Have you picked a lot of strawberries?
- Yes! But my mummy and daddy keep eating them!
- Oh, is this the way out?
- I never want to see a strawberry ever again!
- I suppose some people just don't like strawberries.
- I must say, these strawberries do look lovely!
- But the real test is if they taste any good.
♪ Straw-berry, straw-berry juicy, red and sweet ♪
♪ Straw-berry, straw-berry they're so nice to eat ♪
we are here to collect strawberries to take home and make jam.
Put them in your baskets and try not to eat too many.
- I'll just have one last one. - Hee, hee!
I suppose one more won't hurt!
This really is the very last one...
Have you come to eat the strawberries?
- The little birds do not want to eat the strawberries.
- Perhaps they have just eaten too many, Peppa. - (burp)
- Yes, I think eaten too many. - Oooh...
Granny and Grandpa's baskets are empty!
- Granny, Grandpa, where are your strawberries?
- Maybe, it's time to go home.
- Here is Danny Dog with his mummy and daddy.
They have just arrived at the strawberry farm.
- I suppose some people just don't like strawberries.
- I see you've picked a lot of strawberries!
- The way out is just through the gift shop.
- What do you sell in your shop, Miss Rabbit?
- Strawberry cake, strawberry cookies, strawberry cheese...
...strawberry juice, strawberry sweets... - Anything without strawberries?
- I think we've had our fill of strawberries, thank you.
- Funny. No one ever buys anything from this shop.
- Miss Rabbit, look at how many strawberries we picked! - Grunt, grunt.
- Well done, Peppa and George! - (till rings)
- Now we can make strawberry jam!
NARRATOR: Peppa and her family are at Granny and Grandpa Pig's house.
(SNORTS) Today, I'm going to make apple and blackberry crumble.
I need you brave explorers to go and get the fruit.
We've got baskets for the apples.
(SNORTS) First, the easy bit, picking apples.
On the count of three, shake the tree.
Why don't we just have apple crumble?
Because blackberries are tasty too, Grandpa.
(SNORTS) Now, that's what I call a blackberry bush.
This bush has been here since I was a little piggy.
I should have cut it down years ago.
Grandpa, why don't you like it?
I don't like the way it looks at me.
Silly Grandpa! It's just a harmless bush.
And it's covered in lovely blackberries.
NARRATOR: George has seen some really big, juicy blackberries.
Careful, George, or you might get tangled.
I have a stick for picking hard-to-reach blackberries.
But the best blackberries are right at the very top.
(SNORTS) That's why I brought the ladder.
Um, don't lean too far over, Mummy Pig.
Don't worry. I've been climbing this blackberry bush
since I was a little girl.
Yes, but you're not a little girl now.
NARRATOR: Oh, dear! Mummy Pig has fallen into the blackberry bush.
MUMMY PIG: Uh, no, I'm stuck.
You're stuck in a thorny bush, like Sleeping Beauty.
-MUMMY PIG: What? -Once upon a time, there was a princess
One day, she fell asleep in a thorny bush,
MUMMY PIG: Yes, that's a nice story, Peppa.
My mummy is in a blackberry bush,
and she'll be there for 100 years.
(LAUGHS) And she'll be rescued by a handsome prince,
who will give her a kiss. (AIR KISSES)
(GIGGLES) My mummy is having an adventure.
I wish my mummy would have adventures like that.
MUMMY PIG: Um, can someone think of a way to get me out of here?
In 100 years, a handsome prince will rescue you.
Grandpa Pig, may I borrow your pruning shears, please?
Of course, you may, brave Sir Daddy Pig.
Take that, you thorny bush, you!
You were meant to stay in there for 100 years.
That was quite long enough, thank you.
I thought this sort of thing only happened to me.
(SNORTS) Stand still while we pick you.
Let's take all this fruit back to Granny Pig.
Granny, Granny, Mummy had an adventure!
And then Mummy fell in the bush.
And she was going, "Ah! Help me! Help me!"
And then Daddy came and rescued her.
I think we've all heard that story enough times now.
I never want to see another blackberry in my life.
So, you don't want any apple and blackberry crumble, then?
NARRATOR: Mummy Pig loves apple and blackberry crumble.
Everyone loves apple and blackberry crumble.
- Peppa and her family are in the kitchen.
Mummy Pig is making an apple pie.
- Is the apple pie ready yet, Mummy?
- No, Peppa. It has to cook in the oven.
- Well it looks like we'll just have to wait.
- We're waiting for the apple pie.
- Well, it's going to take time to cook! Snort!
Why don't you all wait somewhere else?
- Well, I was going to do my crossword puzzle,
but I can't find anything to write with.
we need to find something for Daddy to write with!
- Grunt, grunt. - George has found Mr. Dinosaur.
- (giggling) You can't write with Mr. Dinosaur!
- George has found a toy train!
- And you can't write with a train! - Oh!
Daddy can write with this! - Grunt, grunt!
We've found something to write with!
- Can we look for something else?
- Okay. Let's play a looking game.
Find something that is the shape of... a square!
- Yes! There must be something square-shaped in this room!
- Can you see a square, George?
- Oh. - We need to find a square.
What shall we look for now?
- Something... that makes.. a squeaky noise.
- Look for something that makes a squeaky noise, George!
Now see if you can find something the colour of...
- Peppa and George have found a ball!
- Peppa and George look in Mummy and Daddy's bedroom.
- Ah, there is nothing blue here.
- Peppa and George look in the office.
- There is nothing in the whole house that is blue!
- Hmmm. Have you looked in the mirror?
- Daddy, the mirror is not blue.
- Mummy, mummy... We've been looking for things.
- Oh. I've got something you can look for.
- A ball! - Round and flat on top.
- Yes! The apple pie is ready!
NARRATOR: Peppa and George are going shopping.
George loves sitting in the trolley.
Daddy, can I sit in the trolley, too?
(CHUCKLES) You're too big for the trolley, Peppa.
(OINKS) But you can help with the shopping.
We've got four things on the list.
NARRATOR: Peppa and George love shopping.
(OINKS) I can see them! I can see them!
-Here are the tomatoes, Mummy. -(OINKS) Well done, Peppa.
Tomatoes. That's one thing off the list.
NARRATOR: Spaghetti is Peppa and George's favorite food.
I wonder where the spaghetti is.
I can see it. (OINKS) This way!
Spaghetti! Look, Mummy, here's the spaghetti.
Well done, Peppa. Let's put the spaghetti in the trolley.
What's next on the list, Peppa?
Crisps are not on the list.
We have plenty of crisps at home, Peppa.
There aren't any dinosaurs in the supermarket.
No, George, the next thing on the list is onions.
That's nearly everything on our list.
There's one last thing on the list.
NARRATOR: A plant? Is that on the list?
The last thing on the list is fruit.
Never mind, George, you can choose the fruit.
NARRATOR: There are apples and oranges
and bananas and a very big melon.
(OINKS) What fruit shall we have, George?
NARRATOR: This is the check-out where all the food is paid for.
NARRATOR: Chocolate cake? Is that on the list?
Peppa, did you put the chocolate cake in the trolley?
George, did you put the chocolate cake in the trolley?
Well, I didn't put it in.
I thought it might be nice for pudding.
Sorry, it just looked so delicious...
Oh, let's pretend it was on the list.
Grandpa Pig has made a chocolate-egg hunt.
No, Grandpa! Freddy Fox isn't here.
I loved egg hunts when I was a little lad.
-(CAR ENGINE STARTS) -Now are we ready for the egg hunt?
There are lots of chocolate eggs hidden in my garden.
(SNORTS) But be careful not to step on my little plants.
Oh, it's so exciting in springtime
to see these baby plants starting to grow.
We promise to be careful, Grandpa.
NARRATOR: Grandpa Pig's chocolate-egg hunt has begun.
Have you got time for a cup of tea, Grandpa Pig?
It will take them ages to find my eggs.
NARRATOR: Peppa has found a chocolate egg in a plant pot.
NARRATOR: Rebecca Rabbit has found a chocolate egg hiding under a leafy bush.
NARRATOR: Emily Elephant has found a chocolate egg in the branches of a tree.
(SNIFFS) I think I can smell chocolate!
NARRATOR: Freddy Fox has a very good sense of smell.
NARRATOR: Freddy Fox has found a chocolate egg in the middle of the birdbath.
Grandpa! Grandpa! We've found the chocolate eggs.
-It was really fun. -But it was a bit easy.
It wasn't easy for the little ones.
NARRATOR: George, Richard and Edmond haven't found any eggs.
I wonder where the other eggs are.
I think there's something behind your ear.
NARRATOR: Everyone has found a chocolate egg.
Squeak! What do we do now, Grandpa Pig?
We found all the chocolate eggs.
Well, where are they? I can't see any eggs.
GRANNY PIG: And round your mouths.
Did Grandpa hide the eggs well?
No. We big ones found them easily.
But the little ones needed helping.
George, Richard and Edmond don't like to be the littlest ones.
Don't worry. There'll soon be even littler ones in the garden.
